episodeTitle: Nami's Cyclone Advisory! Clima Takt Burst!
description: Nami battles Miss Doublefinger while learning to use Usopp's new Clima-Tact weapon. Meanwhile, Crocodile interrogates King Cobra about the ancient weapon Pluton and reveals his devastating plans to Vivi.

events.title: Nami vs Miss Doublefinger Battle Begins
events.description: Miss Doublefinger finds Nami hiding in the palace and attacks her with spike abilities. Nami decides to fight using her new weapon from Usopp.
events.significance: This is Nami's first major solo battle in the series, showcasing her growth as a fighter and her ability to use strategy and meteorological knowledge in combat.

events.title: Clima-Tact Weapon Debut
events.description: Nami reveals the Clima-Tact weapon that Usopp created for her. She recalls his explanation of the weapon's features and begins testing it in battle.
events.significance: The Clima-Tact becomes Nami's signature weapon throughout the series, allowing her to use her meteorological knowledge in combat. This marks a major evolution in her fighting capability.

quotes.text: This is the weapon Usopp made for me! Time to see what it can do!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami prepares to use the Clima-Tact for the first time in battle

events.title: Fine Tempo Debut
events.description: Nami tries her first Clima-Tact move, Fine Tempo, which creates doves as a party trick. She is disappointed to learn it has no combat value.
events.significance: Shows the initial misunderstanding between Usopp's design intentions (party tricks) and Nami's combat needs, setting up her creative adaptation of the weapon.

events.title: Cloudy Tempo Debut
events.description: Nami activates Cloudy Tempo, which produces flowers when a button is pushed. Another useless party trick that frustrates her.
events.significance: Continues to emphasize the weapon's original party-oriented design, building tension before Nami discovers the actual combat configurations.

events.title: Thunder Tempo Debut
events.description: Nami uses Thunder Tempo, which springs out a boxing glove. Yet another non-combat party trick that leaves her vulnerable.
events.significance: The third failed attempt heightens the danger as Miss Doublefinger continues her assault, forcing Nami to find real combat applications.

events.title: Discovery of Clima-Tact's Real Combat Features
events.description: While hiding and reading the instruction manual, Nami discovers the battle configurations at the back. She learns each baton can create hot air (Heat Ball), cool air (Cool Ball), and electricity (Thunder Ball).
events.significance: This discovery transforms the Clima-Tact from a toy into a viable combat weapon, allowing Nami to use her meteorological expertise to create powerful weather-based attacks.

quotes.text: Wait! There are battle configurations at the back of the manual!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami discovers the real combat potential of the Clima-Tact

events.title: Cyclone Tempo Debut
events.description: After being stabbed in the calf, Nami swings the Clima-Tact and unintentionally creates Cyclone Tempo, generating a powerful gust of wind that pushes Miss Doublefinger back.
events.significance: Nami's first successful combat technique with the Clima-Tact, demonstrating the weapon's true potential when used by someone with meteorological knowledge.

events.title: Mirage Tempo Debut
events.description: When Miss Doublefinger appears to skewer Nami, a dove flies through revealing it was just an illusion. Nami explains she used Mirage Tempo to create a mirage of herself.
events.significance: Demonstrates Nami's quick learning and strategic mind, using the Clima-Tact's features creatively to evade attacks through optical illusions.

quotes.text: That was Mirage Tempo! My Clima-Tact can create mirages!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami reveals how she escaped Miss Doublefinger's attack

events.title: First Mention of Pluton
events.description: Crocodile interrogates King Cobra about the location of Pluton, one of the three Ancient Weapons. Cobra is shocked that Crocodile knows this name.
events.significance: This is the first mention of Pluton in the series, introducing the concept of Ancient Weapons that becomes crucial to the overarching story. It reveals Crocodile's true motivation for taking over Arabasta.

quotes.text: Tell me, King Cobra... where is Pluton?
quotes.speaker: Crocodile

quotes.text: How do you know that name?!
quotes.speaker: King Cobra
quotes.context: Cobra's shocked reaction to hearing about Pluton

events.title: Crocodile's True Goal Revealed
events.description: Crocodile explains he needs Pluton as a weapon to establish military power and counter the World Government. His entire plan to take over Arabasta was to find this ancient weapon.
events.significance: Reveals the true depth of Crocodile's ambitions beyond just ruling a kingdom. He seeks power to challenge the World Government itself, adding layers to his character and the world's political structure.

quotes.text: I need a weapon to establish my military power and be able to counter the World Government forces!
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile reveals why he wants Pluton

events.title: Crocodile Reveals the Bomb Plot
events.description: Crocodile informs Vivi and Cobra that he planted a bomb set to explode in Palace Square at 4:30, one and a half hours after the rebels and royal guard clash.
events.significance: Escalates the urgency of the situation dramatically, putting a time limit on stopping the war and saving thousands of lives in Alubarna.

quotes.text: I've planted a bomb to explode in the Palace Square at 4:30!
quotes.speaker: Crocodile

events.title: Crocodile Claims Luffy is Dead
events.description: Crocodile tells Vivi that Luffy is dead, crushing her hopes and causing her to despair. He blames Vivi for Luffy's death, saying he would still be alive if he hadn't gotten involved with her.
events.significance: Creates emotional devastation for Vivi and raises the stakes of the conflict. Sets up dramatic tension for when Luffy's survival is revealed.

quotes.text: Luffy would have still been alive had he not gotten involved with you!
quotes.speaker: Crocodile

events.title: Miss Doublefinger's Toge Toge no Mi Abilities Demonstrated
events.description: Miss Doublefinger demonstrates multiple techniques of her Spike-Spike Fruit, including Double Stinger, Stinger Finger, Stinger Hedgehog, Sewing Stinger, and Stinger Step.
events.significance: Showcases the full versatility of the Toge Toge no Mi devil fruit, establishing Miss Doublefinger as a formidable opponent capable of turning any body part into deadly spikes.

events.title: Nami's Declaration of Readiness
events.description: Having finally understood how the Clima-Tact works, Nami confidently tells Miss Doublefinger that she is now ready to actually fight.
events.significance: Marks Nami's transformation from a support character who runs from fights to a capable combatant. Shows her intelligence and adaptability in turning a seemingly useless weapon into an effective tool.

quotes.text: Now I'm ready to actually fight!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's confident declaration after mastering the Clima-Tact basics

quotes.text: Tell me, King Cobra... where is Pluton?
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile reveals his true goal to King Cobra

quotes.text: Now I'm ready to actually fight!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's declaration after understanding the Clima-Tact

quotes.text: I need a weapon to establish my military power and be able to counter the World Government forces!
quotes.speaker: Crocodile

themes.description: Nami demonstrates that combat effectiveness comes from understanding and creativity, not just raw power. Her meteorological knowledge transforms a toy into a weapon.
themes.symbolism: The Clima-Tact represents how knowledge and intelligence can be weaponized effectively.

themes.description: Crocodile's true goal is revealed to be far grander than just ruling Arabasta - he seeks power to challenge the World Government itself.
themes.symbolism: Pluton represents the ultimate power that ambitious individuals seek to change the world order.

themes.description: Vivi faces despair as Crocodile reveals Luffy's supposed death and the bomb plot, yet the episode ends with Nami finding hope through understanding her weapon.
themes.symbolism: The contrast between Vivi's darkness and Nami's growing confidence highlights different responses to adversity.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami evolves from a support character into a capable solo fighter, using her intelligence and meteorological knowledge to adapt a party trick weapon into a combat tool.
keyActions: Successfully uses Cyclone Tempo and Mirage Tempo
Declares readiness to truly fight Miss Doublefinger
quotes: Now I'm ready to actually fight!
That was Mirage Tempo! My Clima-Tact can create mirages!

characterSpotlights.development: Crocodile's character deepens as his true ambition is revealed - not just to rule a kingdom, but to acquire an ancient weapon to challenge the World Government.
keyActions: Reveals his plan to use Pluton against the World Government
Psychologically tortures Vivi about Luffy's death
Reveals the bomb plot in Palace Square
quotes: Tell me, King Cobra... where is Pluton?
I need a weapon to establish my military power and be able to counter the World Government forces!

characterSpotlights.development: Vivi experiences crushing despair as she learns of Luffy's supposed death and the bomb that will kill thousands of her people.
keyActions: Refuses to believe Luffy is dead
Learns about Crocodile's true goal of finding Pluton

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some of the battle sequences between Nami and Miss Doublefinger compared to the manga.
The anime shows more detail in Nami testing each Clima-Tact party trick feature.

trivia.fact: This episode contains an animation error at timestamp 19:57 where Crocodile is shown lighting his cigar with both hands, with his hook and rings nowhere to be seen.
Episode 117 marks the first mention of Pluton in the anime, introducing the concept of Ancient Weapons that becomes central to the series' overarching plot.

The Clima-Tact weapon introduced in this episode becomes Nami's signature weapon throughout the entire series, evolving through multiple versions including Perfect Clima-Tact, Sorcery Clima-Tact, and eventually incorporating Zeus.
The episode aired with an 11.7% TV rating in Japan, ranking 6th for that week.
Interestingly, the Clima-Tact actually appeared in the opening song 'Hikari e' one episode before its debut in the actual anime.
